intro: Coleosanthus adenocarpus var. glandulipes, commonly known as the glandular-armed sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in small, glandular hairs. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in coastal environments and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a notable species within the Malvaceae family.
